docs.snippet: An Iranian government institution promoting sports and a healthy lifestyle effectively banned Zumba classes for being contrary to Islamic precepts.

headline.print_headline: Iran Bans Zumba, but Exercise’s Hip-Shaking Fans Say It ‘Will Not Be Stopped’
headline.main: Iran Bans Zumba, and Its Fans Fume

docs.snippet: How is writing a letter to the editor of a newspaper a strong act of citizenship?

headline.print_headline: What Would You Write in a Letter to the Editor?
headline.main: What Would You Write in a Letter to the Editor?

docs.snippet: Who is this man and what has he done with my father?

headline.main: My Dad’s Sudden Outburst: ‘I Love You’

docs.snippet: Rich and gamy, these have found their way onto restaurant menus and can be made easily at home.

headline.main: Become a Disciple of Duck Wings

docs.snippet: Friday: Three very colorful houses, a new state budget and a California Batman.

headline.main: California Today: Batman, a True Angeleno

docs.snippet: People have wondered if the Amazon chief was waiting until retirement to make a big charitable splash. In a tweet, he solicited ideas from the public.

headline.print_headline: Want to Help Bezos Donate His Billions? Just Tweet Him
headline.main: At Last, Jeff Bezos Offers a Hint of His Philanthropic Plans

docs.snippet: The elegant, lyrical work from “The Black Photographers Annual,’’ a four-volume anthology published between 1973 and 1980 that showcased black photographers, is now exhibited at the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts.

headline.main: An Elegant, Lyrical Look at Black Lives by Black Photographers

docs.abstract: The elegant, lyrical work from “The Black Photographers Annual,’’ a four-volume anthology published between 1973 and 1980 that showcased black photographers, is now exhibited at the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts.

docs.snippet: This ever-expanding museum of contemporary art gives populism a good name. Every visitor can find something to like — and probably dislike, too.

headline.print_headline: It’s a Site for All Eyes
headline.main: MASS MoCA: It’s a Site for All Eyes

docs.snippet: Ms. Le Pen and her rival in France’s presidential election, Emmanuel Macron, visited a factory separately and received starkly different welcomes.

headline.print_headline: Le Pen Draws Cheers at a Factory in Macron’s Hometown, and He Gets Boos
headline.main: Marine Le Pen Draws Cheers in Macron’s Hometown, and He Gets Boos

docs.snippet: Michelle Carter, who pressed Conrad Roy III to kill himself, was convicted in a rare finding that a person’s words can directly cause someone else’s suicide.

headline.print_headline: Young Woman Who Urged Friend to Commit Suicide Is Found Guilty
headline.main: Guilty Verdict for Young Woman Who Urged Friend to Kill Himself
